meanings.definition: The state or quality of being oppressive.
meanings.sent1: The oppressivenesses of the dictator's rule made life unbearable for the citizens.
meanings.sent2: The oppressivenesses of the summer heat made it hard to breathe.
meanings.sent3: The oppressivenesses of the heavy rain made the umbrella turn inside out.
meanings.sent4: The oppressivenesses of the silence in the room felt suffocating.
meanings.sent5: The oppressivenesses of the dark clouds looming overhead foretold a storm.

meanings.definition: The feeling of being weighed down or burdened by something oppressive.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't shake off the oppressivenesses of her past mistakes.
meanings.sent2: The oppressivenesses of the workload made him feel exhausted.
meanings.sent3: The oppressivenesses of the tight shoes made her dance awkwardly.
meanings.sent4: The oppressivenesses of the guilt weighed heavily on his conscience.
meanings.sent5: The oppressivenesses of the backpack full of books made her shoulders ache.
